title: Facebook on the App Store
description: The official Facebook app for iPhone and iPad on the Apple App Store lets you connect with friends, family, and communities through a personalized Feed where you can explore and expand your interests. You can shop Marketplace for hidden gems, ask Meta AI for information and get interactive results, dive into Reels that reflect your interests, and use generative AI to create custom stickers and images. The app allows you to join groups, privately message friends, customize your profile, create Reels from trending templates, and capture moments with Stories. Requires iOS 15.1 or later and is available in 32 languages with in-app purchases for Stars and Supporter subscriptions.

title: Instagram - Apps on Google Play
description: The official Instagram app for Android lets you connect with friends, share photos and videos, and explore your interests through a personalized Feed. Create and discover short entertaining videos with Reels, share everyday moments that disappear after 24 hours with Stories and Notes, start group chats with Close Friends, and customize your posts with exclusive templates, music, stickers, and filters. Dive into your interests by watching videos from your favorite creators, discovering new content in Explore, and shopping products from brands and small businesses relevant to your personal style, all powered by Meta.

title: Facebook - Apps on Google Play
description: The official Facebook app for Android lets you connect with friends, family, and communities through a personalized Feed, share photos and videos, create Reels with editing tools, shop on Marketplace, join Groups, message privately, and use generative AI to create custom stickers and images. Available for free download on Google Play with features like video and voice calls, Stories, events, gaming, and business pages all in one place.

description: Facebook Privacy Basics is an interactive guide that explains fundamental privacy concepts in simple terms, covering who can see your content, how to control your information, managing friend lists, blocking unwanted contacts, and understanding your data on the platform.

title: Facebook Ad Preferences
description: Facebook Ad Preferences allows users to view and control how their information is used for advertising, including seeing why specific ads are shown, managing ad topics, hiding ads from certain advertisers, and controlling data used to personalize ads across Facebook.

title: Cambridge Analytica Scandal Explained
description: The New York Times provides comprehensive coverage of the Cambridge Analytica scandal, explaining how the political consulting firm harvested data from millions of Facebook users without consent, the company's use of that data for political advertising, and the resulting fallout for Facebook's reputation and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Facebook Antitrust Lawsuits - FTC

title: Facebook Data Breach 2021

title: The Facebook Files - WSJ Investigation

title: Facebook's Impact on Democracy
description: The Washington Post analyzes Facebook's role in democracy, examining how the platform's algorithms amplified divisive content during elections, spread misinformation, enabled foreign interference, and created echo chambers that may have influenced political discourse and voting behavior worldwide.

title: Facebook and Mental Health Research

title: History of Facebook - Wikipedia
description: Wikipedia's detailed history of Facebook traces the platform's evolution from Mark Zuckerberg's Harvard dorm room in 2004, through its expansion to other colleges, high schools, and eventually the general public, major milestones like the News Feed launch, acquisitions, IPO, and rebranding as Meta.

title: The Founding of Facebook - Harvard Crimson
description: The Harvard Crimson's original 2004 article reports on the launch of 'Thefacebook' from Mark Zuckerberg's dorm room, capturing the earliest days of the platform when it was exclusively for Harvard students, before its explosive growth into the global social network it would become.

title: The Social Network (Film) - IMDb
description: IMDb's page for 'The Social Network,' the Academy Award-winning film directed by David Fincher about the founding of Facebook, starring Jesse Eisenberg as Mark Zuckerberg, exploring the legal battles, friendships, and controversies surrounding the creation of the world's largest social network.

title: Facebook Acquires Instagram

title: Facebook Acquires WhatsApp

title: Facebook Acquires Oculus

title: Facebook Rebrands as Meta

title: Facebook
description: Facebook is the world's largest social networking platform where users create personal profiles, share photos and videos, connect with friends and family, join communities through Groups, buy and sell items on Marketplace, and discover content through News Feed. Founded by Mark Zuckerberg in 2004, it remains the most widely used social media platform globally with billions of active users.

title: Instagram
description: Instagram is a photo and video sharing social networking service owned by Meta Platforms. Users can upload media that can be edited with filters and organized by hashtags and geographical tagging. Posts can be shared publicly or with pre-approved followers. Key features include Stories, Reels, IGTV, and direct messaging, making it a leading platform for visual content creators, influencers, and businesses.

title: Google
description: Google is the world's most popular search engine, handling over 3.5 billion searches daily. Beyond web search, Google offers a suite of products including Gmail for email, Google Maps for navigation, Google Drive for cloud storage, Google Docs for productivity, YouTube for video sharing, and the Chrome browser. Founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin in 1998, Google has expanded into advertising, cloud computing, hardware, and artificial intelligence.

title: YouTube
description: YouTube is the world's largest video sharing platform where users can upload, view, rate, share, and comment on videos. Launched in 2005 and acquired by Google in 2006, YouTube hosts billions of hours of content including music videos, tutorials, vlogs, live streams, documentaries, and entertainment. Features include channels, subscriptions, playlists, YouTube Shorts, YouTube Music, and YouTube Premium for ad-free viewing.

title: Twitter
description: Twitter is a microblogging and social networking service where users post and interact with messages known as 'tweets'. Registered users can post, like, and retweet tweets, while unregistered users can only read them. Tweets were originally limited to 140 characters but doubled to 280 in 2017. Features include trending topics, hashtags, lists, Spaces for audio conversations, and Twitter Blue subscription. It's widely used for news, entertainment, politics, and real-time updates.

title: LinkedIn
description: LinkedIn is the world's largest professional network on the internet, used for career development, job searching, professional networking, and business connections. Members create profiles highlighting their work experience, education, skills, and recommendations. Features include job postings, company pages, LinkedIn Learning for courses, professional groups, and content sharing in a news feed format. It's essential for recruiters, job seekers, and professionals building their personal brand.

title: Reddit
description: Reddit is a social news aggregation, content rating, and discussion website. Registered members submit content such as text posts, direct links, and images, which are then voted up or down by other members. Content is organized by user-created boards called 'subreddits' covering virtually any topic. Popular subreddits include r/funny, r/AskReddit, r/todayilearned, and r/science. Reddit is known for its passionate communities, AMAs (Ask Me Anything), and internet culture influence.

title: Pinterest
description: Pinterest is a visual discovery and bookmarking platform where users find and save ideas for various projects and interests. Users create boards to organize 'pins' - images or videos linked to external sources. Popular categories include home decor, fashion, recipes, DIY projects, beauty, and travel. Pinterest serves as both a social media platform and a visual search engine, helping users discover inspiration and plan future purchases or activities. It's particularly popular among crafters, planners, and lifestyle enthusiasts.

title: Snapchat
description: Snapchat is a multimedia messaging app known for its ephemeral content - photos and videos called 'Snaps' that disappear after being viewed. Key features include Stories (24-hour photo/video collections), Filters and Lenses (AR effects), Chat messaging, Snap Map for location sharing, and Spotlight for user-generated short videos. Popular among younger demographics, Snapchat emphasizes privacy, creative expression, and real-time communication with friends through visual content.

title: TikTok
description: TikTok is a short-form video hosting platform where users create and share videos ranging from 15 seconds to 10 minutes. Owned by ByteDance, TikTok features an algorithmic 'For You' feed that serves personalized content based on user interactions. The platform is known for viral trends, challenges, dances, lip-syncing, comedy sketches, and educational content. TikTok has become a major force in pop culture and music discovery, with powerful editing tools, effects, and a massive music library for creators.

title: Amazon
description: Amazon is the world's largest e-commerce and cloud computing company. Originally an online bookstore, it has expanded to sell everything from electronics and clothing to groceries and streaming media. Key services include Amazon Prime for fast shipping and video streaming, Amazon Web Services (AWS) for cloud computing, and Kindle for e-books. The platform features customer reviews, personalized recommendations, and third-party seller marketplace, making it the go-to destination for online shopping worldwide.

title: Wikipedia
description: Wikipedia is a free, multilingual online encyclopedia written and maintained by a community of volunteer contributors through open collaboration. Launched in 2001 by Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger, it is the largest and most-read reference work in history, featuring over 60 million articles in 300+ languages. Articles are created, edited, and verified by volunteers, following a neutral point of view policy. Wikipedia is nonprofit, ad-free, and relies on donations, serving as an essential resource for quick facts, research, and general knowledge worldwide.

title: Netflix
description: Netflix is a subscription-based streaming service offering a vast library of TV shows, movies, anime, documentaries, and original content across various genres. Founded in 1997 as a DVD rental service, Netflix transformed into a streaming giant and leading production studio with critically acclaimed originals like Stranger Things, The Crown, and Squid Game. Available in over 190 countries, Netflix features personalized recommendations, multiple user profiles, download for offline viewing, and plans ranging from ad-supported to 4K Ultra HD streaming.

title: WhatsApp
description: WhatsApp is a free, cross-platform messaging and voice-over-IP service owned by Meta. It allows users to send text messages, voice messages, make voice and video calls, and share images, documents, and location. Key features include end-to-end encryption for privacy, group chats with up to 1024 participants, WhatsApp Web for desktop access, and Status for ephemeral photo/video updates. With over 2 billion users worldwide, WhatsApp is the primary communication app in many countries for personal and business messaging.

title: Zoom
description: Zoom is a video conferencing platform that provides remote conferencing services combining video conferencing, online meetings, chat, and mobile collaboration. Launched in 2013, Zoom became essential during the COVID-19 pandemic for remote work, education, and social connections. Features include HD video and audio, screen sharing, virtual backgrounds, breakout rooms, webinar hosting, and recording capabilities. Available on desktop, mobile, and web browsers with both free and paid plans supporting up to 1000 participants.

title: VK
description: VK (formerly Vkontakte) is the largest social network in Russia and Eastern Europe. It offers features similar to Facebook, including personal profiles, messaging, communities and groups, photo and video sharing, music streaming, and gaming. Owned by VK Group, it's a dominant platform for communication, entertainment, and news in Russian-speaking countries, with over 100 million monthly active users.

title: Discord
description: Discord is a voice, video, and text communication platform designed for creating communities. Originally popular with gamers, it has expanded to accommodate all kinds of interest groups, study groups, and professional teams. Users organize conversations in 'servers' with text and voice channels, and can make direct calls. Features include screen sharing, streaming, custom emojis, and extensive moderation tools, making it a leading platform for online communities.

title: Telegram
description: Telegram is a cloud-based instant messaging and voice-over-IP service focused on speed and security. Known for its robust privacy features including end-to-end encrypted 'Secret Chats' and self-destructing messages, it also offers powerful group messaging with up to 200,000 members, channels for broadcasting to unlimited audiences, and extensive bots for automation. With apps for all major platforms, Telegram has become a primary communication tool for both personal use and large communities worldwide.

title: Twitch
description: Twitch is the world's leading live streaming platform for gamers, creatives, and entertainers. Acquired by Amazon in 2014, Twitch allows broadcasters to stream their gameplay, music production, art creation, or 'just chatting' sessions to live audiences. Viewers can interact through chat, subscribe to channels, and support creators with 'Bits' and donations. With millions of daily active users, Twitch has built a vibrant culture around live interaction, esports, and community building.

title: Quora
description: Quora is a social question-and-answer platform where users ask questions and receive answers from community members, including experts in various fields. Founded in 2009, Quora covers millions of topics, allowing users to follow subjects and get personalized feeds. Answers can be upvoted, downvoted, and commented on, with quality content often surfacing through community curation. It serves as a valuable resource for knowledge sharing, market research, and content marketing.

title: Bing
description: Bing is Microsoft's web search engine, launched in 2009 as the successor to Live Search. It provides traditional search results alongside features like image and video search, maps, news, and translation. Bing is deeply integrated into Microsoft products, including Windows, Office, and Edge browser. It powers Yahoo! Search and offers unique features like visual search, rewards program, and AI-powered Copilot for conversational search. As the second largest search engine in the US, it serves billions of searches monthly.

title: ChatGPT
description: ChatGPT is an AI-powered conversational assistant developed by OpenAI, capable of understanding and generating human-like text based on user prompts. Launched in 2022, it rapidly became one of the fastest-growing consumer applications in history. ChatGPT can answer questions, write content, summarize text, translate languages, generate creative ideas, and assist with coding and problem-solving. Available as a web platform and mobile app, it offers both free access and premium subscriptions with advanced features like image generation and web browsing.

title: LINE
description: LINE is a Japanese instant messaging, social media, and entertainment platform dominant in Japan, Taiwan, Thailand, and other Asian markets. Originally developed as a communication tool after the 2011 Thoku earthquake, LINE has evolved into a comprehensive 'smart portal' offering messaging, voice and video calls, social timeline, news, mobile payments, manga, gaming, and a vast ecosystem of stickers. With over 200 million monthly active users, it's deeply integrated into daily life in East and Southeast Asia.

title: Yahoo!
description: Yahoo! is a global web services provider offering a web portal, search engine, and suite of digital services including Yahoo News, Yahoo Finance, Yahoo Mail, and Yahoo Sports. Founded in 1994, it was one of the internet's pioneering companies. Today, Yahoo reaches hundreds of millions of users through its content aggregation, email service, and financial tools. Despite changes in ownership, Yahoo remains a major destination for news, finance data, and email communications.

title: Fandom
description: Fandom (formerly Wikia) is a wiki platform and community hosting service for fan-created content about entertainment franchises. Covering thousands of topics including movies, TV shows, video games, books, and comics, Fandom hosts over 250,000 community-driven wikis. It's the go-to destination for in-depth fan knowledge, character backstories, episode guides, game walkthroughs, and lore discussions. Fandom combines user-generated encyclopedia content with news, quizzes, and videos for passionate fan communities.

title: Medium
description: Medium is an online publishing platform founded by Twitter co-founder Ev Williams, designed for long-form writing and thoughtful discourse. It hosts a mix of professional journalism, personal essays, and industry expertise from both established writers and amateur contributors. Medium's clean reading interface, clapping system for appreciation, and curated publications make it popular for in-depth articles on technology, culture, self-improvement, and current events. Readers can follow topics and writers, while the Partner Program allows writers to earn money based on engagement.

From surf spots in Kuta to wellness retreats in Ubud, Bali offers diverse experiences. Visitors search for temple tours, Instagram-worthy spots, villa rentals, and the perfect balance of relaxation and adventure in this Indonesian paradise.

title: Phuket - Thailand's Largest Island
description: Phuket ranks No.3 most searched travel destination globally, Thailand's largest island known for beautiful beaches, vibrant nightlife, and water activities. Patong Beach offers entertainment, while quieter Kata and Karon appeal to families. Visitors search for Phi Phi Island tours, Phang Nga Bay's limestone karsts, elephant sanctuaries, and the perfect mix of relaxation and adventure in this tropical paradise.

title: Doha - Qatar's Capital
description: Doha ranks No.4 most searched travel destination, emerging as a major stopover hub with its world-class airport and growing tourism infrastructure. Qatar's capital offers futuristic architecture, the Museum of Islamic Art, traditional souqs, and desert adventures. Visitors search for layover ideas, luxury hotels, cultural experiences, and the city's rapid transformation for the 2022 World Cup and beyond.

title: Auckland - City of Sails
description: Auckland ranks No.5 most searched travel destination, New Zealand's largest city known for its harbors, volcanic hills, and multicultural vibe. The 'City of Sails' offers Sky Tower views, island visits in the Hauraki Gulf, and easy access to beaches and wine regions. Visitors search for things to do, day trips, and the perfect base for exploring North Island attractions.

title: Singapore - Garden City
description: Singapore ranks No.6 most searched travel destination, a futuristic city-state renowned for its cleanliness, efficiency, and multicultural heritage. Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the Bay, Sentosa Island, and world-class food from hawker centers attract millions. Visitors search for stopover ideas, family attractions, shopping, and the unique blend of Chinese, Malay, and Indian cultures in this tropical metropolis.

title: Hamilton Island - Whitsundays Paradise
description: Hamilton Island ranks No.7 most searched travel destination and No.1 trending domestic destination in Australia. This Whitsundays island offers Great Barrier Reef access, white-sand beaches, luxury resorts, and the famous qualia retreat. Visitors search for sailing trips to Whitehaven Beach, Heart Reef scenic flights, accommodation options, and the ultimate Queensland island experience.

title: Los Angeles - City of Angels
description: Los Angeles ranks No.8 most searched travel destination, America's entertainment capital with Hollywood glamour, beautiful beaches, and diverse neighborhoods. Visitors search for Universal Studios, Hollywood Walk of Fame, Santa Monica Pier, and celebrity spotting. LA's sprawling landscape offers everything from museum-hopping to hiking in Runyon Canyon, making it a perennial favorite in travel searches.

title: Lord Howe Island - Pacific Paradise
description: Lord Howe Island ranks No.9 most searched travel destination and No.2 trending domestic destination in Australia. This UNESCO World Heritage site in the Tasman Sea limits visitors to protect its pristine environment, offering coral reefs, forested mountains, and uncrowded beaches. Visitors search for accommodation, flight bookings, and unique experiences like snorkeling at Ned's Beach and hiking Mount Gower.

title: Honolulu - Hawaiian Gateway
description: Honolulu ranks No.10 most searched travel destination, Hawaii's capital and gateway to Oahu's attractions. Visitors search for surfing lessons, luaus, hiking trails, and the perfect balance of city amenities and island paradise in this tropical metropolis.

title: Rome - Eternal City
description: Rome ranks in top international travel lists, Italy's capital rich with 2,500 years of history. The Colosseum, Roman Forum, Vatican City, and Trevi Fountain attract millions who search for ancient history, Renaissance art, and Italian cuisine. Visitors plan itineraries around major sights, seek hidden gems, and dream of throwing coins into the Trevi Fountain for good luck.

title: Bilbao - Spanish Cultural Gem
description: Bilbao took the top spot as the most searched-for destination of 2025 globally. This Spanish city in the Basque Country transformed with the iconic Guggenheim Museum, blending avant-garde architecture with traditional charm. Visitors search for its revitalized waterfront, pintxos cuisine, and unique Basque culture that propelled it to the pinnacle of travel searches this year.

title: Barbados - Caribbean Paradise
description: Barbados ranked as the second most searched destination of 2025, buoyed by new flight options and hotel openings. This Caribbean island offers pink-sand beaches, British colonial heritage, rum distilleries, and vibrant culture. Visitors search for all-inclusive resorts, surfing on the east coast, cave exploration, and the warm hospitality that makes it a perennial favorite in tropical travel searches.

title: Santander - Spanish Coastal Gem
description: Santander ranked No.4 most searched destination globally, capital of Cantabria in northern Spain. This elegant coastal city offers beautiful beaches like El Sardinero, the Magdalena Palace, and fresh seafood. Visitors search for its Belle poque architecture, ferry connections to the UK, and as a gateway to exploring the lush landscapes of Green Spain.

title: Ibiza - Balearic Party Island
description: Ibiza ranked No.5 most searched destination globally, famous for world-class nightclubs and electronic music scene. Beyond the parties, this Balearic island offers stunning coves, whitewashed villages, hippie markets, and UNESCO-listed old town Dalt Vila. Visitors search for club tickets, beach clubs, villa rentals, and the perfect mix of hedonism and relaxation in this Mediterranean paradise.

title: Malaga - Costa del Sol Capital
description: Malaga ranked No.7 most searched destination globally, capital of Costa del Sol in southern Spain. Birthplace of Picasso, it offers world-class art museums, Moorish fortress the Alcazaba, Roman theatre, and beautiful beaches. Visitors search for its year-round sunshine, cruise port, tapas bars, and as a base for exploring Andalusia's white villages and Mediterranean coastline.

title: Reykjavk - Iceland's Capital
description: Reykjavk ranked No.8 most searched destination globally, the world's northernmost capital and gateway to Iceland's otherworldly landscapes. This colorful city offers geothermal pools like the Blue Lagoon, Northern Lights viewing, volcanic exploration, and unique Nordic culture. Visitors search for winter adventures, summer midnight sun, Golden Circle tours, and the raw beauty surrounding this unique capital.

title: Basel - Swiss Cultural Hub
description: Basel ranked No.9 most searched destination globally, Switzerland's third-largest city on the Rhine River bordering France and Germany. Famous for its Art Basel fair, 40 museums including the Kunstmuseum, and medieval old town, it attracts culture seekers. Visitors search for its carnival (Fasnacht), Rhine swimming, and as a base for exploring the Swiss, French, and German borders.

title: Dsseldorf - German Fashion Capital
description: Dsseldorf ranked No.10 most searched destination globally, western Germany's fashion and business hub on the Rhine. Known for its Knigsallee shopping boulevard, Altstadt (Old Town) with 300 pubs, Japanese quarter, and cutting-edge architecture, it attracts style-conscious travelers. Visitors search for its media industry, trade fairs, and as a gateway to the Ruhr region.

title: Upstate New York Weekend Getaway
description: Upstate New York topped the list of US weekend getaway searches in 2025, offering nature escapes within driving distance of major cities. The Catskills, Hudson Valley, Finger Lakes, and Adirondacks provide hiking, waterfalls, farm-to-table dining, and charming small towns. Visitors search for fall foliage, cabin rentals, wineries, and the perfect restorative escape from urban life.

title: Joshua Tree National Park
description: Joshua Tree ranked No.2 US weekend getaway search in 2025, where the Mojave and Colorado deserts meet in Southern California. Famous for its namesake trees, rugged rock formations, and dark skies for stargazing, it attracts climbers, campers, and spiritual seekers. Visitors search for camping reservations, hiking trails, bouldering routes, and the unique desert photography opportunities.

title: Sedona - Arizona's Red Rock Country
description: Sedona ranked No.3 US weekend getaway search in 2025, famous for dramatic red rock formations, vortex sites, and New Age spirituality. This Arizona desert town offers hiking, jeep tours, art galleries, and luxury resorts amidst stunning scenery. Visitors search for vortex locations, scenic drives like Oak Creek Canyon, and the perfect blend of outdoor adventure and wellness retreat.

title: Charleston - Southern Charm
description: Charleston ranked No.4 US weekend getaway search in 2025, South Carolina's historic port city known for pastel-colored houses, cobblestone streets, and world-class dining. Rainbow Row, Fort Sumter, and plantation gardens attract history buffs, while foodies search for she-crab soup and shrimp and grits. Visitors plan walking tours, carriage rides, and coastal getaways to this Southern belle.

title: Las Vegas - Entertainment Capital
description: Las Vegas ranked No.5 US weekend getaway search in 2025, Nevada's desert oasis known for casinos, shows, and nightlife. The Strip's themed hotels, Fremont Street, and world-class entertainment draw millions. Visitors search for show tickets, buffet deals, pool parties, and day trips to the Grand Canyon, Red Rock Canyon, and Hoover Dam from this 24-hour playground.

title: Nashville - Music City

The Grand Ole Opry, Ryman Auditorium, and Broadway's honky-tonks draw music lovers, while families search for the Parthenon, Centennial Park, and kid-friendly attractions. Visitors plan itineraries around live music, hot chicken, and Southern hospitality in this vibrant city.

Visitors search for Biltmore tickets, Blue Ridge Parkway drives, and the funky River Arts District.

Visitors plan trips around game days, explore the revitalized downtown, and discover this classic American city's Midwestern charm.

Families search for the Children's Museum of Indianapolis (largest in the world), Indianapolis Zoo, and White River State Park. Visitors explore the Canal Walk, NCAA Hall of Champions, and this affordable Midwest destination's family-friendly attractions.

title: Portland - Oregon's Eco-Friendly City

Visitors explore the International Rose Test Garden, Saturday Market, and this eco-conscious city's weird and wonderful attractions that appeal to all ages.

title: Poconos - Pennsylvania Mountain Escape

Couples search for cozy cabins, all-inclusive resorts with heart-shaped tubs, hiking trails, and the perfect escape from East Coast cities.

title: Outer Banks - North Carolina Coast

valley of fire things to do

description: Livraria Lello in Porto, Portugal topped global bookstore searches on Google Maps in 2025. Rowling's Harry Potter descriptions, it draws literary pilgrims. Visitors search for tickets, wait times, and the magical atmosphere of this iconic bookshop.

title: Animate Ikebukuro - Tokyo Anime Hub
description: Animate Ikebukuro in Tokyo ranked No.2 global bookstore search in 2025, Japan's largest anime and manga retail chain's flagship store. title: 2026: AI Drives Performance at Meta
description: Meta's official announcement details how AI advancements in early 2026 are driving performance across its platforms, including a 7% lift in Facebook feed views, double-digit video time spent growth, AI dubbing available in nine languages with hundreds of millions of daily views, and significant improvements in ad ranking and business messaging tools.

title: Meta Tests Premium Subscriptions on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp
description: Meta announces plans to test premium subscription tiers across Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp in early 2026, offering exclusive features like unlimited audience lists, anonymous Story viewing, and AI-powered tools including the recently acquired Manus AI agent, while keeping core app functionality free for all users.

title: Meta's 2026 Social Trends: AI, Creators, and Cross-Border Commerce
description: Meta reveals its five major social and business trends for 2026, highlighting how generative AI is transforming shopping experiences through virtual try-ons and AI assistants, the integration of AI in business messaging across Messenger and WhatsApp, creator-led commerce with affiliate marketing, and the rise of cross-border e-commerce enabled by AI automation.

title: Meta to Shut Down Messenger's Standalone Website
description: Meta confirms the closure of messenger.com in April 2026, with users automatically redirected to facebook.com/messages for web-based chats, while those using Messenger without a Facebook account will need to use the mobile app and can restore chat history using a PIN created during backup setup.

description: Mark Zuckerberg outlines his vision for the future of social networks driven by AI, with Meta investing $135 billion in 2026 to create platforms that not only recommend content but also generate personalized videos, images, and interactive experiences, potentially flooding feeds with AI-created media while increasing user engagement on Instagram through AI translation features.

title: Meta's 2026 Community Trends: AI, Creators, and Interactive Commerce
description: Meta presents its 2026 social trends for brands, emphasizing how multimodal AI enables virtual try-ons and product comparisons, business messaging AI tools handling customer service across Messenger and WhatsApp, creator partnerships driving over 80% of consumer purchases, and live streaming with AR try-ons creating immersive shopping experiences across Facebook and Instagram.
